plugins.name: Offgrid.fm
plugins.description:
Offgrid.fm is a lightweight Figma plugin that quietly monitors your design canvas and alerts you when someone is viewing your work without interacting. Whether you're collaborating on sensitive projects or just want more visibility into your workspace and helps you stay in control.


Key Features:

  1. Real-time detection of inactive observers
  2. Instantly identifies who's viewing your designs
  3. Helps protect your creative privacy and intellectual property
  4. Runs silently in the background without disrupting your workflow


Currently supports the Figma Web App only. *


Ideal for designers handling confidential work, remote teams, and creatives who value situational awareness in collaborative environments.
plugins.tagline: You've got eyes on you üëÄ

plugins.name: FileFlow
plugins.description:
FileFlow helps you instantly create organized file structures in Figma with predefined workflows for different project types.

Create consistent, well-structured Figma files without the tedious manual work. With FileFlow, you can:


Choose from pre-built templates for different workflows (Research, UI Design, Webflow, Product, Agency, and more)

  1. Create custom page hierarchies with intuitive organization
  2. Add sections and dividers to group related pages
  3. Use emoji icons to visually distinguish different page types
  4. Save time on project setup with one-click implementation


Perfect for teams that want to standardize their Figma file organization or individuals looking to streamline their workflow. FileFlow makes it easy to maintain clean, professional file structures that improve collaboration and productivity.


Tags

organization, workflow, file structure, pages, productivity, project management, templates, file setup

These details have been optimized for searchability while accurately describing what your plugin does. The description highlights key benefits and features that would appeal to Figma users looking for organization solutions. I've also included relevant tags that potential users might search for when looking for plugins like yours.

plugins.name: Feed Names, Get Frames (16:9, 1280x720)
plugins.description:
This plugin allows to batch-create 1280*720px (16:9) frames with user-defined names.


The frames will be created in the centre of the viewport, unless something is in the way ‚Äî in this case it will place them to the bottom right of the conflicting element, and the frames created will remain selected for further batch manipulation. Frame size works well for YouTube thumbnails.


Useful for established design workflows, especially centred around YouTube design, with high volumes and short turnaround times.


Assuming that 1 manual frame creation+naming takes 5 seconds, then for 10 frames the plugin increases the efficiency by x50. And even more for a larger number of frames.

accepted.name: Alexandra (Sasha) Hunter
accepted.description: I do graphic and product design.

plugins.tagline: Paste a list of titles ‚Äî¬†get frames with those titles

plugins.name: UIEditor-Exporter
plugins.description:
A utility plugin by Quicksave Interactive to make the workflow between Figma and the UI Editor a seamless experience.


This plugin allows you to export your Figma Designs to be used inside of the Quicksave UI Editor.


Be sure to read this to understand how to properly use this Exporter:


  1. Current supported UI Editor nodes are: Container, Text, Sprite.
  2. Figma's Fill and Strokes are converted to Sprite nodes (SVGs).
  3. Avoid having your UI bleeding outside their parent nodes.
  4. Keep a clear hierarchy and try to use descriptive and unique names for your nodes.
  5. You must save each image individually using the Exporter with the default name in the folder you specified. If you change these names / folders, you can update this in the UI Editor.
  6. If you encounter a missing feature, please email support for this plugin so we can look into it.
plugins.tagline: Exports Figma Designs to be used in Quicksave's UI Editor

122173.name: UIEditor-Exporter
122173.description:
A utility plugin by Quicksave Interactive to make the workflow between Figma and the UI Editor a seamless experience.


This plugin allows you to export your Figma Designs to be used inside of the Quicksave UI Editor.


Be sure to read this to understand how to properly use this Exporter:


  1. Current supported UI Editor nodes are: Container, Text, Sprite.
  2. Figma's Fill and Strokes are converted to Sprite nodes (SVGs).
  3. Avoid having your UI bleeding outside their parent nodes.
  4. Keep a clear hierarchy and try to use descriptive and unique names for your nodes.
  5. You must save each image individually using the Exporter with the default name in the folder you specified. If you change these names / folders, you can update this in the UI Editor.
  6. If you encounter a missing feature, please email support for this plugin so we can look into it.
122173.release_notes:
* UI Editor parentSize values will not exceed three decimal places after the export. 
* Text Node Horizontal Alignment and Vertical Alignment has been improved. A new container Node will be created per Text Node to ensure consistent Position and Alignment.
122173.tagline: Exports Figma Designs to be used in Quicksave's UI Editor

plugins.name: Recount
plugins.description:
Recount replaces text layers with a counter, starting from any number, based on the XY position of each selected layer.


How to use:

  1. select the layers to be counted
  2. run Recount
  3. enter a number to start from (or hit ENTER to choose 1)
  4. choose a direction to count along (or hit ENTER to use LTR)


Left-to-right and right-to-left directions are available.
plugins.tagline: Easily count layers by their position

plugins.name: Reorder Nested Instances Tool
plugins.description:
Reorder Nested Instances lets you reorder nested instances inside any Figma component instance. No detaching.


To undo a reorder, you can:

* Select the canvas and use 'Undo' (Cmd+Z / Ctrl+Z).

* Restore your file using Version History (before the plugin was applied).


Note: Support for persisting style overrides is actively being worked on - Please support this plugins development by providing feedback on the form found here.
plugins.tagline: Reorder nested instances with ease!

plugins.name: UX Buddy
plugins.description:
Transform your design process with instant, expert-level UX feedback.


UX Buddy is your personal design critic that never sleeps. This powerful Figma plugin analyzes your frames and provides instant, actionable feedback based on proven UX principles and industry best practices.


What UX Buddy Does:

‚ú® **Instant UX Analysis** - Get comprehensive design feedback in seconds, not hours

üéØ **Actionable Insights** - Receive specific, implementable recommendations to improve your designs

üé® **Visual Design Review** - Analyze color usage, typography, spacing, and visual hierarchy

üì± **Accessibility Checks** - Ensure your designs meet accessibility standards and guidelines

üöÄ **Workflow Integration** - Seamlessly integrates into your existing Figma workflow


Key Features:

- **Smart Color Analysis** - Detect contrast issues and color harmony problems

- **Typography Review** - Identify font pairing, hierarchy, and readability issues

- **Layout Evaluation** - Analyze spacing, alignment, and visual balance

- **UX Best Practices** - Get feedback based on established design principles

- **Detailed Reports** - Receive comprehensive analysis with prioritized recommendations

- **Real-time Feedback** - Instant analysis as you design


Perfect For:

- **Product Designers** looking to validate their design decisions

- **UX/UI Designers** wanting to ensure best practices

- **Design Teams** seeking consistent quality standards

- **Freelancers** who need expert-level feedback

- **Students** learning design principles


How It Works:

1. Select any frame in your Figma file

2. Click the UX Buddy plugin

3. Get instant, expert-level analysis

4. Implement suggested improvements

5. Create better user experiences


**Professional-grade analysis** - Providing comprehensive design critique and UX insights based on industry standards and proven methodologies.


Stop guessing about your design decisions. Let UX Buddy guide you toward creating exceptional user experiences that delight and convert.

accepted.description: I craft digital products that empower people and drive business growth.

plugins.tagline: Expert UX analysis that makes your designs better, instantly.

plugins.name: CopySpark - AI Copywriter
plugins.description:
CopySpark ‚Äì is an AI-powered Figma plugin built for designers. Powered by ChatGPT and Gemini, it helps you write clear, effective UX copy without leaving your canvas.


‚ú® Easily write new content from scratch.

üîÅ Instantly generate alternative versions.

‚ö° Work faster with AI instructions tailored to your tone and context.


Say goodbye to blank text boxes ‚Äî let AI help you craft and iterate copy in seconds!


How to Use

  1. Choose your AI model ‚Äì ChatGPT or Gemini.
  2. Enter your API key for the selected model.
  3. Select a text layer in your Figma file.
  4. Choose whether to generate alternatives for the selected text or write new copy from a prompt.
  5. Click ‚ÄúGo‚Äù to generate options, then click the version you like to insert it into your text layer.


Get Gemini API Key

Get ChatGPT API Key
plugins.tagline: AI copywriting powered by ChatGPT & Gemini! Write and iterate with ease!

plugins.name: datify
plugins.description:
Quickly update or increment dates across selected frames or text layers. It's perfect for tables, planners, and any layout where dates need to be updated regularly.


  1. Set a start date and automatically increment dates within each frame or across multiple frames
  2. Auto-detect the existing date values across selected frames
  3. Retain the original date format or choose from a list of supported formats
  4. Skip hidden layers
  5. Choose whether to increment dates continuously across all selected frames or restart within each frame
  6. Set the increment to 0 to update all date values to the same date
  7. Enter a minus sign (‚Äì) before the number to decrement the dates instead.


üìÖ Supported date formats:

  1. MMM D (Jan 31)
  2. D MMM YYYY (31 Jan 2025)
  3. D MMMM YYYY (31 January 2025)
  4. MMMM D, YYYY (January 31, 2025)
  5. YYYY-MM-DD (2025-01-31)
  6. DD/MM/YYYY (31/01/2025)
  7. DD-MM-YYYY (31-01-2025)
  8. D/M/YYYY (5/6/2025)
  9. M/D/YY (1/31/25)
  10. YYYY/MM/DD (2025/01/31)
  11. MMMM YYYY (January 2025)
  12. D MMM YY (31 Jan 25)
  13. D.M.YYYY (31.01.2025)
  14. YYYY. M. D (2025. 1. 31)
plugins.tagline: A quick way to update and format dates in your designs

plugins.name: Lingo
plugins.description:
Lingo helps designers and design teams scale products across multiple markets faster by streamlining localization. Effortlessly translate your designs into multiple languages ‚Äî we handle conversion so you can focus on adaptation.


How to use:


  1. Open the plugin
  2. Select entire frame/specific section with content to be translated
  3. Select preferred language and translate.


Use cases:


Lingo will be useful for you or you team if you:


  1. Operate in multiple markets ‚Äì Whether you're launching globally or scaling your existing products across regions, Lingo ensures seamless translation and localization.
  2. Need fast, high-quality translations ‚Äì Quickly adapt marketing materials, product descriptions, and support docs without sacrificing accuracy.
  3. Work with visual content ‚Äì Effortlessly translate social media graphics, posters, infographics, ads, and blog visuals while preserving design integrity.
  4. Manage multilingual blogs and articles ‚Äì Localize blog posts, newsletters, and landing pages while maintaining SEO optimization.
  5. Run international ad campaigns ‚Äì Adapt ad copy, video subtitles, and CTAs for different audiences with culturally relevant messaging.
  6. Collaborate with global teams ‚Äì Streamline workflows by enabling real-time translation for internal documents, presentations, and training materials.
  7. Support customer experience (CX) ‚Äì Provide multilingual customer service content, FAQs, and chatbots for better engagement.


Lingo helps you break language barriers efficiently, so you can focus on adaptation and growth, not conversion.


We'd love to hear from you!‚ù§Ô∏è

How are you using Lingo? What‚Äôs working well, and what could be even better? Your feedback helps us improve and serve you best‚Äîso don‚Äôt hesitate to share your thoughts, wishes, or even tiny frustrations.


Drop us a note at ajaoabdulsamad2000@gmail.com.

plugins.name: Blueprint
plugins.description:
Blueprint is a UX documentation tool that helps create UX flows & development instructions lightning fast. Just import your Figma designs to Blueprint and create UX flows on its grid-based canvas.

Visit blueprintapp.design to learn more about Blueprint!


Key features:

  1. Import Figma design: Import selected frames or the entire page.
  2. Grid canvas: Arrange and organize Figma frames super fast.
  3. UX flowchart: Draw UX flows with arrows and diagrams using Figma designs, making it easier to communicate with your teammates.
  4. Add annotations: Write down instructions or detailed guidance about a selected scene for clearer communications.


To get started:

  1. Install the Plugin from the Figma Community
  2. Enter your Figma File URL
  3. Choose specific Frames or import all Frames to Blueprint
  4. Click the "Open on Blueprint" button to begin designing your UX flows
plugins.tagline: High-fidelity UX Flows Made Effortless

plugins.name: ColourSwatch
plugins.description:
Enhance your Figma workflow with the ColourSwatch plugin


Streamline the creation, management, and updating of colour swatches using local or published Figma colour variables. This plugin provides a clear visual overview of all the colours in your project, ensuring consistency and efficiency.


With this plugin, you can easily create a ColourSwatch component. For each colour variable ‚Äîwhether from a local collection or a linked, published Figma library ‚Äî you can generate a component instance. Use the plugin to effortlessly update values such as hex codes, alpha values, and colour variable names ‚Äî one by one or as a batch for all colour swatches on the same page.
plugins.tagline: Create maintain and update colour swatches based on your Figma colour variables.

plugins.name: Renamer
plugins.description:
Renamer ‚Äî Smarter Layer Naming


A Figma plugin that keeps your layers organized by automatically generating clear, descriptive names based on their properties. Perfect for maintaining a consistent and readable file structure in complex designs.


Just select your layers and run the plugin ‚Äî names will be updated instantly based on your settings.


Layer properties included:

  1. Dimensions (width √ó height)
  2. Fill color (HEX code)
  3. Opacity values
  4. Effects (shadows, blurs)
  5. Constraints
  6. Corner radius
  7. Stroke details
  8. Auto Layout settings

‚ùñ Generate Unique Names: Ensure each selected text field gets a distinct, random name.

‚ùñ Customizable Gender Selection: Choose from male or female names based on your project needs.

‚ùñ Surname Option: Add Thai surnames for a complete name experience.

‚ùñ Easy Integration: Select your text fields, click "Generate", and watch your text change instantly!

plugins.description: Unit is a lightweight tool that helps designers and developers extract CSS friendly measurements directly from Figma. No more manual conversions, just copy and paste values into your code.
plugins.tagline: Copy CSS Ready Code From Figma Instantly.

plugins.name: Customizable Variable Export
plugins.description:
A UI that lets you export your variables to JSON and TypeScript.


Customize your JSON exports with:

  1. flat or nested structures
  2. hex-codes or RGBA values for colors


Find the project on GitHub: helpwave/figma-export-plugin
plugins.tagline: Export your variables to JSON and TypeScirpt!
